The Great Chapter
. The Story of Nandaka the Ghost
The king named Piṅgalaka,
the lord of Suraṭṭha,
having gone to the service of the Moriyas,
returned to Suraṭṭha.
In the hot midday hour,
the king approached a mud-hole;
he saw a delightful path,
the way of the ghosts.
The king addressed the charioteer:
“This path is delightful,
safe, good, and auspicious;
by this, charioteer, let us go,
near to Suraṭṭha.”
Soraṭṭha went by that way,
with an army of four divisions;
a man with a frightened appearance,
said this to Soraṭṭha:
“We have gone on a bad path,
frightening, making the hair stand up;
in front a path is seen,
but behind it is not seen.
We have gone on a bad path,
near to the messengers of Yama;
a non-human smell blows,
a terrible sound is heard.”
King Soraṭṭha was alarmed,
and said this to the charioteer:
“We have gone on a bad path,
Frightening, making the hairs bristle;
In front the path is seen,
but behind it is not seen.
We have entered the wrong path,
in the presence of the messengers of Yama;
A non-human smell is blowing,
a terrible sound is heard”.
